html: Those whom Jehovah gathers from exile to his “holy mountain” and gladdens in his “house of prayer” (v 7) ultimately include peoples of all nations (Isaiah 2:3; 25:6; 27:13; 30:29; 66:20). Their offerings and sacrifices (v 7) are acceptable on Jehovah’s altar precisely because they are what he requires under the terms of his covenant, more especially the Davidic Covenant (Isaiah 19:21; 38:3; 53:11-12; 60:7; 66:20). Although they are outcasts or exiles among the nations of the world, Jehovah acknowledges them as his people and gathers them home (Isaiah 11:12; 27:12-13; 43:5-8; 45:13; 57:1).
